intro: Amorphophallus forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' giant arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its large,戟-shaped (spear-shaped) leaves and striking, spadix-like inflorescence. The plant produces a thick, starchy underground tuber that is used as a food source in some regions. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its unique appearance and culinary potential, it is of interest to both botanists and horticulturists.
